description.en: The course gives an introduction to soft robotics discipline, its relevant technologies, and its relation to nature in the context of bioinspired design.
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate pehmerobootikast kui teadusvaldkonnast, olulistest tehnoloogiatest ning seostest loodusega bioinspireeritud disaini näol.

objectives.en: The student will gain skills to identify practical scenarios efficiently solved using modern bioinspired soft robotic technologies.
objectives.et: Üliõpilased omandavad oskuse tuvastada praktilisi olukordi, mis on efektiivselt lahenduvad moodsa bioinspireeritud pehmerobootikatehnoloogia vahenditega

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course, the student can:
1.	define the application domain for soft robotics;
2.	explain the relation of soft robotics to robotics, chemistry, and biology;
learning_outcomes.et: 2.	Seletada pehmerobootika seost robootika, keemia ja bioloogiaga;

learning_outcomes.en: 3.	explain the defining concepts in soft robotics using relevant examples;
learning_outcomes.et: 3.	Seletada pehmerobootika võtmemõisteid, kasutades sobivaid näiteid;

learning_outcomes.en: 4.	list, explain and compare the prevalent technologies in modern soft robotics;
learning_outcomes.et: 4.	Loetleda, seletada ja võrrelda levinud pehmerobootikatehnoloogiaid;

learning_outcomes.en: 5.	critically read and elaborate on scientific texts on soft robotics.
learning_outcomes.et: 5.	Lugeda kriitiliselt ja analüüsida pehmerobootika-alast teadusteksti;

learning_outcomes.en: 6.	list the particular advantages of soft robotics, using relevant examples,
learning_outcomes.et: 6.	Loetleda pehmerobootika eeliseid, kasutades sobivaid näiteid;

learning_outcomes.en: 7.	explain the benefits of bioinspired design in relevant contexts;
learning_outcomes.et: 7.	Seletada bioinspireeritud disaini eeliseid, kasutades sobivaid näiteid;

learning_outcomes.en: 8.	Identify elements in nature that are relevant for soft robotics and formulate their core principles in terms of robotics technology;
learning_outcomes.et: 8.	Identifitseerida pehmerobootika jaoks tähenduslikke elemente looduses ning formuleerida vastavaid printsiipe robootikakeeles;

learning_outcomes.en: 9.	apply the principles of soft (bioinspired) robotics by suggesting a new design in a practical setting;
learning_outcomes.et: 9.	Rakendada pehme (bioinspireeritud) robootika põhimõtteid originaalses praktilises disainis.

description.et:
Aim of homework: 
-	explain the relation of soft robotics to robotics, chemistry, and biology;
-	critically read and elaborate on scientific text on soft robotics.
-	list the particular advantages of soft robotics, using relevant examples,
-	explain the benefits of bioinspired design in relevant contexts;

For passing you need:
-	understanding of the technical content;
-	presentation according to the provided template;
-	clarity of the written text for a non-specialist audience.
A -  The presentation is properly formatted and shows an outstanding level of interpretation for the technical content. The text delivers the content outstandingly, yet is written at a level easily understood for a non-specialist audience.
B -  The presentation is properly formatted and shows a very good level of interpretation for the technical content. The text delivers the content at a very good level, yet generally understood for a non-specialist audience.
C -  The presentation is properly formatted and shows an adequate level of interpretation for the technical content. The text is mostly understood for a specialist reader, yet delivering the essential technical content.
D -  All requested aspects are generally addressed, but lack of detail. The presentation shows inconsistencies, yet interprets the core of the technical content. The text is generally understood for a specialist reader, yet showing some inconsistency in technical content.
E -  The student has attempted to respond to all the requested aspects, yet showing inconsistencies in formatting and technical content. The specialist reader needs some reference to the original.

-	tehnilisest sisust arusaamine;
-	esitluse vastavus etteantud mallile;
-	teksti arusaadavus mittespetsialistile.
A -  Esitlus on vormistatud korrektselt ning näitab suurepärasel tasemel interpretatsiooni algmaterjali tehnilisest sisust. Tekst annab tehnilise sisu suurepäraselt edasi ning on lihtsalt arusaadav mittespetsialistidele.
B - Esitlus on vormistatud korrektselt ning näitab väga heal tasemel interpretatsiooni algmaterjali tehnilisest sisust. Tekst annab tehnilise sisu väga hästi edasi ning on arusaadav mittespetsialistidele.
C -  Esitlus on vormistatud korrektselt ning interpreteerib tehnilist sisu heal tasemel. Tekst on hästi arusaadav vaid eriala tundvale inimesele, kuid on tehniliselt korrektne.
D -  Kõik kavapunktid on käsitletud, kuid üksnes pinnapealselt.  Esitluses esinevad ebatäpsused, kuid kajastab teemat korrektselt. Tekst on üldiselt arusaadav spetsialistile ning tehniline sisu on ebaühtlane.
E -  Üliõpilane on proovinud käsitleda kõiki ettekandes nõutud punkte, kuid nii vormistus kui tehniline sisu on konarlik.  Teksti lugemisel vajab isegi vastava ala spetsialist üksikutel juhtudel originaalteksti kõrvale.

Aim of group work:
-	define the application domain for soft robotics;
-	Explain the relation of soft robotics to robotics, chemistry, and biology;
-	list the particular advantages of soft robotics, using relevant examples,
-	explain the benefits of bioinspired design in relevant contexts;
-	Identify elements in nature that are relevant for soft robotics and formulate their core principles in terms of robotics technology;
-	apply the principles of soft (bioinspired) robotics by suggesting a new design in a practical setting;

For passing you need:
-	Justified choice of the project topic
-	Definition and conduction of the role in the group
-	Level of argumentation, referencing and structuring in the report
A -  The presented topic is very well justified. The student's role in the group is clearly defined and demonstrably executed. The report is written in an exemplary manner, the choice of references and the connection to the topic is exemplary, the analysis and interpretation are given at an exemplary level, the connections drawn are very logical.
B -  The presented topic is well justified. The student's role in the group is clearly defined and demonstrably executed. The report is written at a high quality, the choice of references and the connection to the topic is very good; the analysis and interpretation are logical.
C -  The presented topic is clear. The student's role in the group is clearly defined and demonstrably executed. The report is written at a generally good quality, but occasionally lacks elaboration and some references are questionable. The analysis and interpretation are logical, but lack of detail.
D -  The presented topic is slightly vague. The student's role in the group is clearly defined and demonstrably executed. The report lacks elaboration in some non-critical aspects, and some references are questionable. The analysis and interpretation are generally logical but lacks detail and structure.
E -  The presented topic is slightly vague. The student's role in the group is clearly defined, but the contribution is limited. The report lacks elaboration in non-critical aspects and lacks some essential references. The analysis and interpretation are generally logical but suffers from low detail and lack of structuring.

Rühmatöö: 
-	Teema originaalne valik ja piiritlemine
-	Rühmatöö rolli määratlemine ja läbiviimine
-	Aruande argumenteeritus, viidatus ja struktureerimine
A -  Valitud teema on väga hästi põhjendatud. Üliõpilase roll grupis on selgelt välja toodud ning nähtavalt ellu viidud. Aruanne on kirjutatud väljapaistval tasemel, viidete valik ning nende seostatus teemaga on suurepärane, analüüs ja interpretatsioon on väljapaistval tasemel, loodud seosed on väga loogilised. 
B -  Valitud teema on hästi põhjendatud. Üliõpilase roll grupis on selgelt välja toodud ning nähtavalt ellu viidud. Aruanne on kirjutatud heal tasemel, viidete valik ning nende seostatus teemaga on väga hea, analüüs ja interpretatsioon on loogilised. 
C -  Valitud teema on selgelt defineeritud. Üliõpilase roll grupis on selgelt välja toodud ning nähtavalt ellu viidud. Aruanne on kirjutatud üldiselt heal tasemel, kuid üksikutes kohtades on teemaarendus poolik ning mõned toodud viited on küsitavad. Analüüs ja interpretatsioon on loogiline, aga vähedetailne. 
D -  Valitud teema on kergelt laialivalguv. Üliõpilase roll grupis on selgelt välja toodud ning nähtavalt ellu viidud. Aruandes on nõrgalt käsitletud mõned mittekriitilised aspektid. Analüüs ja interpretatsioon on üldiselt loogiline, aga vähedetailne ja mõningate puudujääkidega struktuuris.
E - Valitud teema on kergelt laialivalguv. Üliõpilase roll grupis on selgelt välja toodud, kuid panus ei ole üheselt selge. Aruanne on üldiselt loogiline, kuid vähedetailne ning struktuuri poolest puudulik.

Aim: critically read and elaborate on scientific text on soft robotics.

Evaluation of other group work:
For passing, the review for the other group's project has to show strong argumentation, showing analysis on the technical content, and written in style common for an expert on the field.

Teise rühma töö hindamine:
arvestuse saamiseks teise rühma projektile koostatud retsensioonile peab see olema hästi argumenteeritud, analüüsima projekti tehnilist sisu ning olema kirjutatud valdkonna eksperdile omases stiilis.

Aim: 
1.	define the application domain for soft robotics;
2.	understand and explain the relation of soft robotics to robotics, chemistry, and biology;
3.	explain the defining concepts in soft robotics using relevant examples
4.	list, explain and compare the prevalent technologies in modern soft robotics;
5.	list the particular advantages of soft robotics in relevant practical contexts,
6.	explain the benefits of bioinspired design in relevant contexts;

Two tests:
-	Understanding the field, its core concepts and terms
-	Answering the questions correctly
A -  90% correct answers 
B -  80% correct answers
C -  70% correct answers
D -  60% correct answers
E -  50% correct answers

Kaks kontrolltööd:
-	Orienteerumine valdkonnas, selle põhimõistetes ja -kontseptsioonides
-	Õigesti vastamine esitatud küsimustele
A -  90% küsimustest õigesti vastatud 
B -  80% küsimustest õigesti vastatud 
C -  70% küsimustest õigesti vastatud 
D -  60% küsimustest õigesti vastatud 
E -  50% küsimustest õigesti vastatud

grade_preconditions.et:
The final grade is issued when all independent tasks have been passed (at least minimum positive grade).

Lõpphinne määratakse, kui kõik iseseisvad tööd on teostatud vähemalt minimaalsele positiivsele hindele

grade_evaluation.et:
The individual tasks give weight to the final grade as follows:
-	 Literature task: 25%
-	Project task: 45%
-	Review task: 10%
-	Tests: 20%

Tööde osakaalud lõpphindes:
-	Töö kirjandusallikaga: 25%
-	Projekt: 45%
-	Retsenseerimine: 10%
-	Tests: 20%

debt_elimination.et:
Üliõpilasele võimaldatakse mittepositiivse hinde korral üks lisakatse testides, töös kirjandusallikaga ning retsenseerimises.
Projekti hinne, mis kujuneb esitluse ning kirjaliku aruande põhjal, on lõplik ning ei kuulu ümbertegemisele.

The student can take one extra attempt on the Tests, the Literature task, and the Review task upon the negative grade.
The Project grade, given upon its presentation and the written report, is final and it can not be changed.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
